pageContext.claim: “I put on judges that – when I got here, I had 145 openings. Nobody’s ever had that before. And that was because something happened in the last three years of Obama where he didn’t put judges on. I think they forgot. I really do, I believe they forgot. And there’s nothing more – you know, there’s probably nothing more important – other than war and peace, there’s probably nothing more important.”
pageContext.analysis: Obama did not forget about nominating federal judges; Republicans in control of the Senate his last two years in office refused to confirm them.
